abstract: The Bear Stearns Companies, Greenhill & Company and three other firms have invested $1 billion to create Ironshore Insurance, an insurer that will be based in Bermuda and will specialize in disaster-prone commercial properties along the Southeast and Gulf coasts of the United States. Robert Clements, who helped start various Bermuda-based insurers including ACE and XL Capital, arranged the financing with his son John Clements. “We see a marketplace that is starved for quality capacity,” Robert V. Deutsch, Ironshore’s chief executive, above, said in a telephone interview.
